So what's going on in the world of Gladiator? I've stopped playing the 
game...gotten old. Nonetheless, I'd like to take it up again if something 
new came out (levels, another game, etc.)

>From: "-Tevildo." <Tevildo@...>
>Reply-To: gladiator@egroups.com
>To: gladiator@egroups.com
>Subject: Re: [gladiator] Digest Number 66
>Date: Thu, 13 Apr 2000 08:33:56 EDT
>
>"<<snip>> ...you INTENTIONALLY sent it for the sole purpose of harming
>others' computers."
>
>Like I have nothing better to do than try to mess with your computer.
>Really. Just drop it.
>
> >I was working on a set a while back, but... frankly, it's too difficult 
>to
> >use the editor effectively.. I mean, I'd be fine if it were text-based or
> >if it were a windows executable or if it had instructions or if it didn't
> >crash all the time (well, on my one system, at any rate)...
>
>If you just send me what you have, I can finish. I find the Scen.exe to be
>very usable... and there ARE instructions. Or are you talking about
>Editor.exe? Now that one is a bit tricky, but there's no need to use it for
>making a whole level. Wait... what ARE you talking about?
>
>
> >DAYOFDRA.MOD is probably a MODULE music file. Go to 
>http://www.modplug.com
> >and grab the modplug player. Open the dayofdra.mod in the player, and you
> >should start hearing music (if it IS a mod file)
>
>DAYOFDRA.MOD was a file LISTED in levels.001, but I've been unable to 
>unpack
>it... it's apparently just some of the extraneous stuff that found its way
>there by accident, like the level 99 that gave all those people 
>conniptions.
>
>C'mon, folks, everyone was foaming at the mouths for a big compilation...
>let's see some files!
>                   -Tevildo.
